page.title: 10The Clock Tower
page.content: In the centre of Friday Bridge stands the clock tower where five roads meet. It was built as a memorial for the dead of the First World War. The names of the dead are: P Bardell, C Barker, A J Bates, P Bates, G W Biggs, C Biggs, E W Drew, J W Fisher, J C Fox, C W Girlestone, H F Hensby, D Hudson, J W Jackson, C W Loughton, J W M Macrow, R Oldfield, H Pell, C W Pettingale, E A Pettingale, J Ransome, W W Stimpson, M Thompson, W M West, S Wright. 260 people raised Â£359.12s.8d. The clock tower was built in 1919. The clock tower is 30 feet high. It is made of pebbledash on brick and tiled with red brossley tiles and has a weather vane. The clock has four faces The clock has an 8 day mechanism that means you only have to wind it up once a week. Mr A Laughton has been winding the clock for the past 40 years.
